titleStmt.title: The tragical death of Dauid Beato[n] Bishoppe of sainct Andrewes in Scotland Whereunto is ioyned the martyrdom of maister George Wyseharte gentleman, for whose sake the aforesayed bishoppe was not long after slayne. Wherein thou maist learne what a burnynge charitie they shewed not only towards him: but vnto al suche as come to their hades for the blessed Gospels sake.
titleStmt.author: Lindsay, David, Sir, fl. 1490-1555.

editionStmt.edition: This text is an enriched version of the TCP digital transcription A07942 of text S104523 in the English Short Title Catalog (STC 18312). Textual changes and metadata enrichments aim at making the text more computationally tractable, easier to read, and suitable for network-based collaborative curation by amateur and professional end users from many walks of life. The text has been tokenized and linguistically annotated with MorphAdorner. The annotation includes standard spellings that support the display of a text in a standardized format that preserves archaic forms ('loveth', 'seekest'). Textual changes aim at restoring the text the author or stationer meant to publish.

respStmt.resp: This text has not been fully proofread

fileDesc.extent: Approx. 85 KB of XML-encoded text transcribed from 44 1-bit group-IV TIFF page images.

publicationStmt.pubPlace: Evanston,IL, Notre Dame, IN, St. Louis, MO

availability.p: This keyboarded and encoded edition of the work described above is co-owned by the institutions providing financial support to the Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership. This Phase I text is available for reuse, according to the terms of Creative Commons 0 1.0 Universal . The text can be copied, modified, distributed and performed, even for commercial purposes, all without asking permission.

titleStmt.title: The tragical death of Dauid Beato[n] Bishoppe of sainct Andrewes in Scotland Whereunto is ioyned the martyrdom of maister George Wyseharte gentleman, for whose sake the aforesayed bishoppe was not long after slayne. Wherein thou maist learne what a burnynge charitie they shewed not only towards him: but vnto al suche as come to their hades for the blessed Gospels sake.

Burrant, Robert. Martyrdom of maister George Wysehart. aut

publicationStmt.publisher: By Iohn Daye, and William Seres, dwellynge in Sepulchres parish, at the signe of the Resurrection, a little aboue Holbourne conduite,

notesStmt.note: Imprint from colophon; publication date conjectured by STC.
"The tragical death of David Beaton" is in verse.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

ns0:epHeader.ns0:title: The temporysour (that is to saye: the obseruer of tyme, or he that chaungeth with the tyme.) Compyled in Latyn by the excellent clarke Wolfangus Muscu
ns0:epHeader.ns0:author: Musculus, Wolfgang
ns0:epHeader.ns0:defectRangePerGrade: The rate of 57.19 defects per 10,000 words puts this text in the D category of texts with between 35 and 100 defects per 10,000 words.
